lockup.title: Introduction to Refactoring
lockup.description: Maxim gives an introduction to reactoring. He first talks about the theory with some examples but later gives a live demo in an Xcode Playground.

lockup.title: Swinject to handle dependency injection
lockup.description: Felipe takes us for a deep dive into Swinject and shows code examples of how to use Swinject. He touches topics like containers, object scopes and how to register and resolve using arguments.

lockup.title: Making OK Videos
lockup.description: Pim shares his experiences on making a the app OK Videos. He explains why he made it, what problems they ran into when they wanted to instantly record video and how they solved the audio synchronisation.

lockup.title: Dependency Injection & Application Architecture
lockup.description: After a short primer in dependency injection, Peter dives deep in several application architectures based on Swinject and describes the pro's and con's of the solutions.

listItemLockup.title: Software development, parenthood, childlessnes and family life
listItemLockup.subtitle: Juan Carlos Ospina Gonzalez

lockup.title: Software development, parenthood, childlessnes and family life
lockup.description: In this meta talk Juan Carlos talks about the difficulties of combining family live with being a software developer. He also highlights how few women there are in this profession and shows examples of how this affects the products that are created.

lockup.title: Rx Driven Development
lockup.description: Lammert Westerhoff shows an example of how he has used Rx in a data rich application to make the app respond to real-time changes. By using a simple JSON file format for its data store as it also makes development and testing a lot easier.

lockup.title: Native Serialization in iOS
lockup.description: In this talks Dmitrii shows a couple of options on how to use native iOS SDK options to serialize objects. He compares them and talks about the advantages and disadvantages.

listItemLockup.title: Machine Learning In Apps
listItemLockup.subtitle: Rogier van den Brink and Ennio Brands

lockup.title: Machine Learning In Apps
lockup.description: After a small introduction about Incentro by Ennio, Rogier dives into the details on how they used machine learning in the app of the Coop supermarket to implement a product scanner that can not only scan barcodes but also recognize real food.

listItemLockup.title: How To Properly Allocate The Fucks You Give
listItemLockup.subtitle: Ellen Shapiro

lockup.title: How To Properly Allocate The Fucks You Give
lockup.description: In this meta talk Ellen explains that it is important to properly allocate the fucks in your life. A fuck being a metaphor for a pointer to something you care about in your personal or professional life.

lockup.title: Applying Redux patterns on iOS
lockup.description: Jaap Mengers shares his findings of experimenting with applying Redux patterns on iOS apps. He learned about Redux from a web project and researched if it could be applied to iOS apps.

lockup.title: MobProgramming
lockup.description: Jelle Alten and a few CocoaHeadsNL members give a live demonstration of MobProgramming. In a short session they write code to solve the well known FizzBuzz problem.

lockup.title: Understanding Artificial Neural Networks
lockup.description: In this talk Niels introduces us to the world of artificial intelligence and machine learning with a talk about neural networks. He ends with a demonstration how a neural network can be teached to detect colors.

lockup.title: Integrating Snapshot testing
lockup.description: Bart shows how snapshot testing can be used in a CI/CD pipeline to detect possibly unwanted changes in the UI of your application. He also compares two well known snapshot testing frameworks.

listItemLockup.title: Speeding up as an iOS developer
listItemLockup.subtitle: Antoine van der Lee

lockup.title: Speeding up as an iOS developer
lockup.description: In this talk Antoine shares some tips on the personal, organizational and programming level on how to become a better iOS developer and speed up your workflow.

lockup.title: Theming with extensions and JSON
lockup.description: Felipe shares a concept on how he has implemented theming in an app he has worked on. By using extensions on UI elements and simple JSON configuration files hw shows how easy it can be to add theming support to the CocoaHeadsNL app.

lockup.title: Tikkie - Growing beyond the app
lockup.description: Rajeev and Sida from the ABN AMRO Tikkie team explain how quickly the Tikkie app has evolved and became a big success. How they started with a minimum viable product and quickly ran into a scaling issues on the backend that forced them to rethink their infrastructure.

lockup.title: Back to the future
lockup.description: Jeroen Bouma explains how the team of the well know Appie app from Albert Heijn changed the old code base written in Objective-C to a modern app written in Swift.

lockup.title: Flitsmeister - When CarPlay?
lockup.description: Apple surprised developers at WWDC 2018 with an announcement that CarPlay would become available for 3rd party navigation apps. Stijn Spijker and Sander van Tulden explain how they implemented it for Flitsmeister and what problems they ran into.

lockup.title: Creating and Debugging iOS Network Extensions
lockup.description: Jeroen Leenarts talks about what it takes to create and debug iOS network extensions. He learned about this while working on an open source project and he shares his experience on how this worked out for him.

lockup.title: Testable iOS Architecture
lockup.description: Roel Spruit talks about how to design your app and create an architecture in your app that makes it more easy to test. He demonstrates this with a small demo app that shows pugs because nothing can convince you more than pictures of cute dogs.

lockup.title: Qardio experience with Core Data
lockup.description: Dmitrii Ivanov gives us an insight view of the experience that the Qardio iOS team has gained over the years by using Core Data. He explains the issues they've had with Core Data, the different stacks you can use and their implementation and performance differences.

lockup.title: Payconiq Clean Architecture
lockup.description: Maria Postupaeva talks about the architecture that Payconiq is using for their iOS app. She explains how views, scenes, interactors and a coordinator all work together to create a framework oriented UI based on reactive programming.

listItemLockup.title: Going from publisher to implementing GDPR
listItemLockup.subtitle: Aernout Peeters

lockup.title: Going from publisher to implementing GDPR
lockup.description: Aernout Peeters gives some insights on the development of apps at the ANWB. How they changed from using external agencies to developing in house. He also gives details on how they implemented the GDPR in their apps and what challenges they were facing.

lockup.title: Some ❤️ for enums
lockup.description: Tjeerd in 't Veen talks about how to use enums in Swift. He explains that they are actually optionals and that they themselves can also be optionals. He gives practical examples on how they can be leverages in real world scenarios and can even be used to replace inheritance or objects or protocols.

lockup.title: The Testing Games: Mocking, yay!
lockup.description: Donny Wals talks about how to use mocking in your tests to simplify your tests and make them easier to maintain.

lockup.title: CocoaHeadsNL apps
lockup.description: Jeroen Leenarts of CocoaHeadsNL will introduce you to the CocoaHeadsNL apps for both iOS and tvOS. They are both open source and open to community contributions. Jeroen explains how they are built and the technologies involved.

listItemLockup.title: How to build a kick-ass document scanner, the simple way
listItemLockup.subtitle: Joost Diepenmaat

lockup.title: How to build a kick-ass document scanner, the simple way
lockup.description: Joost Diepenmaat, co-founder of Moneybird, is giving an in-depth view on how Moneybird built a versatile document scanner. Nobody is using flatbed scanners anymore, smartphones are always in your pocket to scan invoices and bills. You'll learn about the global architecture, design decisions and the algorithms underneath.

listItemLockup.title: The history of Philips Hue, an enlightening experience!
listItemLockup.subtitle: Jurian de Cocq van Delwijnen

lockup.title: The history of Philips Hue, an enlightening experience!
lockup.description: Jurian de Cocq van Delwijnen enlightens us about the history of the app. He goes into the growing pains that they’ve experienced and the challenges of developing software for IoT products brings.

lockup.title: Kotlin for Swift developers
lockup.description: Ellen Shapiro of Bakken & Bæck explains the differences and similarities between Swift and the new language for Android developers Kotlin.

listItemLockup.title: Creating a 3D game in Swift (in 2 days)
listItemLockup.subtitle: Robert-Hein Hooijmans

lockup.title: Creating a 3D game in Swift (in 2 days)
lockup.description: Robert-Hein Hooijmans from Bakken & Bæck demonstrates the power of SceneKit by showing what he could create in just one weekend. Without any previous experience he was able to create a nice scene with nice visual effects. He even added custom made 3D models created in Blender and custom made fonts.

lockup.title: Rijksmuseum ArtViewer
lockup.description: Tom Lokhorst from Q42 talks about how they developed the ArtViewer for the Rijksmuseum app. This viewer is a highly optimised image viewer to display very large images. It efficiently uses caching and tiling to save memory and bandwidth.

lockup.title: Functioning Functionally
lockup.description: Klaas Pieter Annema tells what he learned from functional programming. The syntax and concepts of generics, closures, promises and functors. How the Argo JSON library makes parsing JSON very simple using functional programming.

lockup.title: AWS Swift codegen
lockup.description: Lammert Westerhoff will present and give a live demo about serverless architecture for iOS apps with AWS API Gateway and AWS Lambda. And then using the Swagger file from the API Gateway to generate an API client in Swift.

listItemLockup.title: Some bits of advice about public speaking
listItemLockup.subtitle: Ellen Shapiro

lockup.title: Some bits of advice about public speaking
lockup.description: Ellen Shapiro (@designatednerd) will talk about het experience in giving talks and what it takes to prepare one. Ellen has given numerous presentations at various events and likes to share the most importants lessons learned.

lockup.title: Lessons in accessibility
lockup.description: In this Talk Bruno Scheele, iOS engineer at Noodlewerk, talks about his lessons learned about making the CocoaHeadsNL iOS app more accessible. He gives examples of easy to implement changes that make your app instantly more accessible.

listItemLockup.title: How to use the BFF patter in the My Vodafone app
listItemLockup.subtitle: Jeroen Zonneveld

lockup.title: How to use the BFF patter in the My Vodafone app
lockup.description: Jeroen Zonneveld, iOS engineer at Triple, talks about how they use the BFF pattern in the My Vodafone app. BFF stands for Backend for Frontend and is a software pattern in which a lot of the business logic of the app is moved to the backend.

lockup.title: Me and my importers
lockup.description: In this talk Donny Wals, engineer at I'M IN, will go over their experiences with a large and complex CoreData setup that uses concurrency and multiple contexts to import a huge amount of data from several API endpoints through a pipeline that makes use of an OperationQueue.

listItemLockup.title: Image Processing and OCS and its applications
listItemLockup.subtitle: Thomas Gmelig Meyling

lockup.title: Image Processing and OCS and its applications
lockup.description: With high quality camera's and great processing power, iPhones are more capable for complex Image Processing tasks than ever. In this presentation Thomas Gmelig Meyling, iOS engineer at M2mobi, will go through several open source libraries that cover barcode scanning and OCR and how to use them in a Swift environment.

lockup.title: Building Reactive User Interfaces
lockup.description: Reactive programming can be a solution, but working with reactive streams can be quite complex. There are a lot of edges cases that you have to deal with. In this talk Tom Lokhorst, iOS engineer at Q42, looks at several ways of building reactive User Interfaces.

listItemLockup.title: Designing a real time data application
listItemLockup.subtitle: Ian Guedes Maia

lockup.title: Designing a real time data application
lockup.description: iOS engineer Ian Guedes Maia of BUX shares the technologies they use to make their app perform well and reactive real-time to the ever changing stock market.

listItemLockup.title: Building smooth and responsive UI with Texture
listItemLockup.subtitle: Eric Scheeres

lockup.title: Building smooth and responsive UI with Texture
lockup.description: To keep its UI performant, Blendle became an early adopter of the Texture framework (formerly known as AsyncDisplayKit). Originally built to make it easy to keep complex UI smooth and responsive, it has grown spectacularly

lockup.title: Reactive programming from scratch
lockup.description: This talk covers the core concepts of reactive programming by looking at a minimalistic implementation in just a few dozen lines of code. The gained insights can be of help when adopting any of the popular reactive programming libraries to your own projects.

lockup.title: Automate everything
lockup.description: Dan Ursu is build tooling engineer at ING bank and in this talk he explains what tools ING is using in their CI solution to build their iOS apps. These tools include Git, GitLab, Jenkins, SwiftLint, Danger and Fastlane.

listItemLockup.title: Building the new WeTransfer Mobile app
listItemLockup.subtitle: Antoine van der Lee

lockup.title: Building the new WeTransfer Mobile app
lockup.description: WeTransfer recently built a new mobile application and Antoine talks about their working culture, open sourcing, their CI setup and taking proper time to set up your environment for effective development.

listItemLockup.title: R.swift - Statically typed resources for iOS
listItemLockup.subtitle: Mathijs Kadijk

lockup.title: R.swift - Statically typed resources for iOS
lockup.description: Mathijs Kadijk presents R.swift at the September 2016 CocoaHeadsNL meetup. R.swift provides statically typed, autocompleted resources like images, fonts and segues in Swift projects.

lockup.title: Swift JsonGen
lockup.description: Tom Lokhorst talks about parsing JSON in Swift. Why is this such a problem? What libraries are there to solve this problem? And how he created a code generator to deal with JSON once and for all.

lockup.title: Protocol-Oriented DataSources
lockup.description: Niels van Hoorn talks about protocol-oriented datasources. Combining James Bond and Swift, Niels does a live coding deep dive into protocols, extensions and type aliases.
